name: INTRO TO LAW & LEG PROC

values.comments:
Legal Studies 101 presents law as an evolving social institution, with special emphasis on the legal regulation of business. It considers basic concepts of law and legal process, in the U.S. and other legal systems, and introduces the fundamentals of rigorous legal analysis. An in-depth examination of contract law is included.

Students thought this was an “amazing course” and that this was an “excellent class all around.” Several students said this was “one of the best classes at Penn.” 

Students also lauded Professor Miller saying he was “engaging,” “exceptional,” and “top-notch.” Students said Professor Miller was a “great lecturer,” and he was able to “stimulate interest in the subject matter.” One student said that Professor Miller was “one of the best professors I have had at Wharton.”

Students commented that the quizzes and midterms were “tricky” but “fair.” Professor Miller made many students think “outside the box” on his exams. LGST 101 can be used to satisfy Wharton core requirements.

LGST 101 presents law as an evolving social institution, with special emphasis on the legal regulation of business. It considers basic concepts of law and legal process, in the U.S. and other legal systems, and introduces the fundamentals of rigorous legal analysis. An in-depth examination of contract law is included.

Most students thought that LGST 101 was “incredibly informative.” Students commented that the “cases we read are always relevant to what we’ve learned.” Several students said that “you don’t need to buy the textbook” because it does not “correspond to the material in the class.”

Nearly every student praised Professor Miller, saying he was “fantastic” and “charismatic.” One student said, “Though Professor Miller lectures the entire class, every class, his way of speaking and explaining concepts is always interesting and clear.” Other students noted that they enjoyed his use of personal and legal stories in class to elucidate class concepts. 

A significant minority of students commented that the grading for this course was “harsh.” Nevertheless, many students recommended this course, and one student commented that LGST 101 is a “great class for anyone who wants to be an informed citizen about the law.” This class, along with LGST 210 and BPUB 203, may be used to fulfill the societal environment requirement in Wharton.

LGST 101 course presents law as an evolving social institution, with special emphasis on the legal regulation of business. It considers basic concepts of law and legal process, in the U.S. and other legal systems, and introduces the fundamentals of rigorous legal analysis. An in-depth examination of contract law is included.

Students all had very positive opinions of LGST 101.  They found the lecture style, which involved a lot of questing and discussion, to be “engaging” and “interesting;” however, a couple students wished the class were “more structured” and provided “slides or... some kind of notes” from which to study for the exams.  While a few students mentioned that the course was “reading intensive,” these students also noted that the readings were “important to learning the course material.”

Students were universally enthusiastic about Professor Constan.  Many students mentioned that his “wit and humor” made him “an incredible lecturer,” and a couple of students particularly mentioned his effective use of the Socratic Method.  A number of students also praised his interest in students and emphasized that “he is very easy to approach and talk to, and in addition to being helpful about the course, he cares about students and takes a genuine interest in them.”
    
A couple of students mentioned that the course was rigorous in terms of material. With the exception of one student who felt that the midterm was “a little too geared towards civil procedure, but the final exam was fair,” students had little to say about the course difficulty.  LGST 101 counts towards the Societal Environment requirement of the Wharton core.
